DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Laboratory Procedure Performed Hematologic Improvement  Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time related to the cell line examined to determine hematologic improvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._A condition superior to an earlier condition._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: neutrophil count increase of greater than or equal to100% from pre-treatment level and an absolute increase of greater than or equal to 500 / mm3

hemoglobin increase of greater than or equal to 1.5 g/dL untransfused; for RBC transfusions performed for Hgb less than or equal to 9.0, reduction in RBC units transfused in 8 weeks by greater than or equal to 4 units compared to the pre-treatment transfusion number in 8 weeks

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HI-P for pre-treatment of platelet count greater than 20 x 10E9/L

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HI-P for pre-treatment of platelet count greater than 20 x 10E9/L
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: for pre-treatment platelet count of > 20 x 10 9L, platelet absolute increase of greater than or equal to 30 x 10 9L; for pre-treatment platelet count of < 20 x 10 9L, platelet absolute increase of greater than or equal to 20 x 10 9L and greater than or equal to 100% from pre-treatment level
